task.title: Write A Post
task.shortdesc: A post is a file filled with site content. Posts are inserted into the layout by Jekyll when it creates the website.

context.p: Posts can be a variety of file types. This means the content can be in whatever format suits it the best. All posts into the _posts folder. Jekyll will take these posts and convert them into a web-friendly format.

step.cmd: Create a file with a filename fitting the required format and of of an appropriate file type in the _posts folder.
step.info: Jekyll can use a variety of file types. Markdown and HTML are the most common. The filename of a post must follow a specific format. This format indicates the date the post was made, and the topic of the post. The following format for the filename is required: YEAR-MONTH-DAY-title.extension

step.cmd: Open the file in a text editor of your choice.
Write content for your post and save it.
Open the post in your browser and double check that it looks correct.
